content.rendered:
I searched Indeed for “dream job” and came up with over 15,000 listings.

We are all different. For some, a dream job would be something that would only take four hours a week, and would make thousands of dollars a week. For others, a dream job would be one where that would include being able to travel all around the world, while others work at a job that they may or may not hope with hopes of one day retiring.

I think my dream job might be working as a travel photographer, traveling in an RV, and taking pictures or shooting video. Maybe I could photograph an occasional wedding.

It’s sometimes difficult to know what we will like or not like until we try something. And things don’t always turn out the way that we had hoped they would. But that doesn’t mean that we shouldn’t try.

A career should match the life that you want to live; the two shouldn’t clash. If you want to spend a lot of time with your family, you probably shouldn’t take a job or start a business that requires that you work 15 hours a day, unless you and your family are working together.

And if your goal is to make millions of dollars by the age of 40, you probably shouldn’t take an hourly position making minimum wage, unless you are working a side job that makes a lot more, or you are able to make up the difference in the stock market.

The thing is, we all have dreams and, unless we go after them, they will remain just that: dreams. When it comes to living our dream isn’t how many times we fall off the horse, or how many obstacles that we come across, but that when we fall, we get back up and, no matter what, we don’t give up.
